intro: Phlomoides ambigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It produces small, two-lipped flowers that are often purple or pink in color. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
